meanings.definition: Fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He promised to help, but then he chose to renege.
meanings.sent2: She always renege on her promises, which makes people upset.
meanings.sent3: The cat said it would catch the mouse, but it decided to renege and take a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to promise a warm day, but then it renege and hid behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The student renege on studying for the test, and ended up failing.

meanings.definition: Go back on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: After agreeing to help, he suddenly renege on his commitment.
meanings.sent2: She tends to renege on her plans at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The dog promised not to eat the cake, but then renege and licked the frosting.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to flow towards the ocean, but then renege and changed its course.
meanings.sent5: The company CEO renege on the agreement, causing chaos among the employees.
